verses.roman:
ācārya bale--akapaṭe karaha āhāra
yadi khāite nā pāra pāte rahibeka āra

synonyms: ācārya bale—Advaita Ācārya says; akapaṭe—without pretense; karaha—kindly do; āhāra—eating; yadi—if; khāite—to eat; nā pāra—You are not able; pāte—on the leaf; rahibeka āra—let the balance remain.
translation: Advaita Ācārya then requested the Lord to simply accept the prasāda without pretense. If He could not eat it all, the balance could be left on the plate.
